title: Email Draft Helper
prompt:
Write a professional email to [recipient] about [topic].

Context: [your situation]
Tone: [professional/friendly/formal]
Key points to include:
- [point 1]
- [point 2]

Keep it concise, under 200 words.

title: Meeting Summary
prompt:
Summarize the following meeting notes into a clear, actionable summary:

[paste meeting notes]

Include:
- Key decisions made
- Action items with owners
- Next steps
- Any open questions

Format as bullet points.

title: Explain Like I'm 5
prompt:
Explain [complex topic] in simple terms that a complete beginner could understand.

Use:
- Everyday analogies
- No jargon or technical terms
- Short sentences
- A concrete example

Keep it under 150 words.

title: Study Guide Creator
prompt:
Create a study guide for [topic/subject].

I need to understand:
- Key concepts and definitions
- Important relationships between ideas
- Common misconceptions
- Practice questions to test my understanding

My current level: [beginner/intermediate/advanced]
Time available: [timeframe]

title: Code Explainer
prompt:
Explain what this code does, line by line:

```
[paste code here]
```

Assume I'm a beginner. Explain:
- What each section does
- Why it's written this way
- Any potential issues or improvements

Use simple language, not technical jargon.

title: Debug Helper
prompt:
I'm getting this error:

```
[paste error message]
```

In this code:

```
[paste relevant code]
```

What I'm trying to do: [describe goal]
What I've already tried: [list attempts]

Help me understand what's wrong and how to fix it.

title: Recipe Modifier
prompt:
Modify this recipe for my dietary needs:

[paste recipe]

My requirements:
- [dietary restriction, e.g., vegetarian, gluten-free, dairy-free]
- Serving size: [number] people
- Skill level: [beginner/intermediate/advanced]

Provide substitutions and any technique changes needed.

title: Travel Itinerary
prompt:
Create a [number]-day itinerary for [destination].

Travel style: [budget/moderate/luxury]
Interests: [list interests, e.g., history, food, nature, art]
Traveling with: [solo/couple/family with kids/group]
Mobility considerations: [any limitations]

Include:
- Daily schedule with timing
- Must-see attractions
- Restaurant recommendations
- Local tips

title: Product Comparison
prompt:
Compare [product A] vs [product B] for [specific use case].

I care most about:
- [priority 1]
- [priority 2]
- [priority 3]

Budget: [range]

Give me a clear recommendation with pros and cons of each.

title: Research Summary
prompt:
Summarize the key points about [topic].

I need to understand:
- What it is and why it matters
- Current state/developments
- Different perspectives on it
- What experts recommend

Audience: [who you're explaining to]
Length: [brief overview/detailed analysis]

title: Cover Letter Writer
prompt:
Write a cover letter for [job title] at [company].

My background:
- Current role: [title]
- Years of experience: [number]
- Key achievements: [list 2-3]

Job requirements to highlight:
[paste key requirements from job posting]

Tone: Professional but personable
Length: Under 300 words

title: Interview Prep
prompt:
Help me prepare for a [job title] interview at [company type].

Generate:
1. 10 likely interview questions for this role
2. Tips for answering each one
3. Questions I should ask the interviewer
4. Key talking points about my experience in [relevant areas]

My background: [brief summary]

title: Social Media Post
prompt:
Write a [platform] post about [topic].

Goal: [inform/engage/promote/entertain]
Tone: [professional/casual/humorous/inspiring]
Audience: [describe target audience]

Include:
- Attention-grabbing hook
- Key message
- Call to action
- Relevant hashtags (if applicable)

Character limit: [number]

title: Content Ideas Generator
prompt:
Generate 10 content ideas for [platform] about [topic/niche].

My audience: [describe]
Content style: [educational/entertaining/inspiring/mixed]
Posting frequency: [daily/weekly]

For each idea, provide:
- The hook/headline
- Brief description of the content
- Best format (video/image/text/carousel)

title: Feedback Giver
prompt:
Review this [type of writing] and give constructive feedback:

[paste text]

Focus on:
- Clarity and flow
- Grammar and style
- Strength of arguments/points
- Suggestions for improvement

Be specific and actionable. Highlight what works well too.

title: Brainstorm Partner
prompt:
Help me brainstorm ideas for [project/problem].

Context: [describe situation]
Constraints: [any limitations]
What I've already considered: [list ideas]

Generate 10 diverse ideas, ranging from safe/conventional to creative/unconventional.

For each idea, give a one-sentence explanation of how it could work.

title: Decision Helper
prompt:
Help me decide between:
- Option A: [describe]
- Option B: [describe]

What matters most to me:
1. [priority]
2. [priority]
3. [priority]

My concerns:
- About A: [concern]
- About B: [concern]

Ask me clarifying questions if needed, then provide a structured analysis.

title: Explain This Article
prompt:
Summarize and explain this article:

[paste article text]

Tell me:
1. The main argument or point (2-3 sentences)
2. Key supporting evidence
3. What's new or important about this
4. Any limitations or counterarguments
5. Why this matters (the "so what?")

Write for someone unfamiliar with the topic.

title: Medical Symptom Organizer
prompt:
Help me organize my symptoms to discuss with my doctor.

Symptoms I'm experiencing:
[list symptoms]

Help me describe:
- When each started
- How often it occurs
- What makes it better/worse
- Severity (1-10)
- Any patterns I should note

Note: This is to prepare for a doctor visit, not to get medical advice.

title: Workout Plan
prompt:
Create a [duration]-week workout plan for [goal].

My situation:
- Current fitness level: [beginner/intermediate/advanced]
- Available equipment: [list]
- Time per session: [minutes]
- Days per week: [number]
- Any injuries/limitations: [describe]

Include warm-up, main workout, and cool-down for each session.
